questions.question_text:
In the past, a company has experienced several network breaches as a result of end-user actions.
To help mitigate future breaches, which of the following documents should the security team ensure are up-to-date and enforced for all employees? (Select TWO)

discussion.content:
Although answers A and E are technically correct, MoU is, however, more accepted to be used between organisations rather than for individuals within an organisation.

I will not go in to further discussion [of semantics] on the matter, lest to share a couple of links below for those inclined to read more on the topic and make their own conclusion. 

Memorandum of understanding (MOU or MoU) 
https://whatis.techtarget.com/definition/memorandum-of-understanding-MOU-or-MoU

AUP
https://techterms.com/definition/aup

questions.question_text: A national cable company providing TV, telephone, and Internet service to home users over its IP network, has been tracking a large increase of network bandwidth due to P2P file sharing. Which of the following should the company deploy to ensure excellent TV and telephone service?

An administrator needs to set up a space in the office where co-workers can relax. The administrator sets up several TV's with interconnected gaming systems in the office.
Which of the following did the administrator set up?

discussion.content: This question is embarrassing. Makes me question all the other answers' legitimacy
That is so wrong, LAN is the correct answer= D
A CAN is for a big campus not a small office
Definitely NOT "CAN" Campus Area Network. Office space w TVs and a gaming system is small, not a campus. It should be LAN.

questions.question_text: Which of the following diagnostic commands relies on proper forwarding of ICMP ECHO packets?
When configuring a WAP for a SOHO, which parameter will BEST limit access to the office area?
